info.title: CJA APIs
info.description: Preliminary spec for Customer Journey Analytics APIs

get.summary: Retrieves feature access for all features.

500.description: Unexpected error; feature access retrieval failed

get.summary: Retrieves feature access for a single feature.

parameters.name: featureId
parameters.description: The feature Id for which to retrieve access information

500.description: Unexpected error; feature access retrieval failed

get.summary: Returns the imsOrg associated with the provided IMS User token

parameters.name: x-gw-ims-org-id
parameters.description: the imsOrgId header

parameters.name: expansion
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of additional metadata fields to include on response.

createDate.description: This cannot be edited by clients

modified.description: This cannot be edited by clients

name.description: Name pulled from ims. This cannot be edited

datacenter.description: Datacenter pulled from UPP. This cannot be edited

fulfillableItems.description: Fulfillable Items. UPP Provisioning data merged together

dataTransferLimit.description: This is based off DX_CJA_DATA_TRANSFER from UPP

dataRestatementLimit.description: This is based off DX_CJA_DATA_RESTATEMENT from UPP

profileCount.description: This is based off DX_CJA_PROFILES from UPP (Profile transfer limit) in the UPP UI

profileTransferLimit.description: This is based off DX_CJA_PROFILE_SIZE from UPP (Profile Size(KB per profile)) or (300 KB per profile) in the UPP UI

profileRestatementLimit.description: This is based off DX_CJA_PROFILES_RESTATEMENT from UPP

concurrentRequests.description: This is based off DX_CJA_CONCURRENT_REQUESTS from UPP (CJA Concurrent Requests) in the UPP UI

apiCallsPerMinute.description: This is based off DX_CJA_API_CALLS from UPP (CJA Api Calls (Calls_Minute_USER)) in the UPP UI

profileTransferLimitQuantity.description: This is based off DX_CJA_PROFILE_SIZE_QUANTITY from UPP (1_UNIT) in the UPP UI

profileTransferTotalSize.description: This is calculated by adding up the product of every profileTransferLimitQuantity and profileTransferLimit pair from every current offer purchased

attributions.description: A boolean that can be set to T/F

dataRows.description: This is based off DX_CJA_DATA_ROWS from UPP

get.summary: Returns all persistent attribute ids
Retrieve a single calculated metric by id
get.description:
A calculated metric response will always include these default items: *id, name, description, rsid, owner, polarity, precision, type* 

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:

* *modified*: Date that the metric was last modified (ISO 8601)
* *definition*: Calculated metric definition as JSON object
* *compatibility*: Products that the metric is compatible with
* *reportSuiteName*: Also return the friendly Report Suite name for the RSID
* *tags*: Gives all existing tags associated with the calculated metric

For more information about calculated metrics go [here](https://github.com/AdobeDocs/analytics-2.0-apis/blob/master/calculatedmetrics.md)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The calculated metric ID to retrieve

parameters.name: expansion
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of additional calculated metric metadata fields to include on response.

parameters.name: includeHidden
parameters.description: Whether to include variables that are hidden in the UI or that the user doesn't have permission to.

parameters.name: toBeUsedInRsid
parameters.description: The report suite where the calculated metric is intended to be used. This report suite will be used to determine things like compatibility and permissions.  If it is not specified then the permissions will be calculated based on the union of all metrics authorized in all groups the user belongs to.  If the compatibility expansion is specified and toBeUsedInRsid is not then the compatibility returned is based off the compatibility from the last time the calculated metric was saved.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

polarity.description: Set metric polarity, which indicates whether it's good or bad if a given metric goes up. Default=positive

precision.description: Number of decimal places to include in calculated metric result

403.description: Requesting non-shared calculated metrics for other users is restricted to admin users

500.description: External API error; calculated metric retrieval failed

parameters.name: expansion
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of additional calculated metric metadata fields to include on response.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Calculated Metric ID to be updated

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON-formatted Object containing key/value pairs to be updated.

polarity.description: Set metric polarity, which indicates whether it's good or bad if a given metric goes up. Default=positive

precision.description: Number of decimal places to include in calculated metric result

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

parameters.name: cached
parameters.description: Use cached results

polarity.description: Set metric polarity, which indicates whether it's good or bad if a given metric goes up. Default=positive

precision.description: Number of decimal places to include in calculated metric result

400.description: Definition must be formatted as a JSON Object

401.description: Company mismatch; calculated metric ownership can only be transferred within the same organization

403.description: User does not have permission to update this calculated metric

500.description: External API error; Calculated metric update or retrieval failed

delete.summary: Deletion of Calculated Metrics by Id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The calculated metric ID to be deleted

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

500.description: External API error; Calculated metric delete failed

get.summary: Retrieve many calculated metrics
get.description:
A calculated metric response will always include these default items: *id, name, description, rsid, owner, polarity, precision, type* 

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:

* *modified*: Date that the metric was last modified (ISO 8601)
* *definition*: Calculated metric definition as JSON object
* *compatibility*: Products that the metric is compatible with
* *reportSuiteName*: Also return the friendly Report Suite name for the RSID
* *tags*: Gives all existing tags associated with the calculated metric

For more information about calculated metrics go [here](https://github.com/AdobeDocs/analytics-2.0-apis/blob/master/calculatedmetrics.md)

parameters.name: expansion
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of additional calculated metric metadata fields to include on response.

parameters.name: includeType
parameters.description: Include additional calculated metrics not owned by user. The "all" option takes precedence over "shared"

parameters.name: dataIds
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics tied to specified RSID list (comma-delimited)

parameters.name: ownerId
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics owned by the specified loginId

parameters.name: filterByIds
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics in the specified list (comma-delimited list of IDs) (this is the same as calculatedMetricFilter, and is overwritten by calculatedMetricFilter

parameters.name: toBeUsedInRsid
parameters.description: The data view where the calculated metric intended to be used.  This data view will be used to determine things like compatibility and permissions.  If it is not specified then the permissions will be calculated based on the union of all metrics authorized in all groups the user belongs to.  If the compatibility expansion is specified and toBeUsedInRsid is not then the compatibility returned is based off the compatibility from the last time the calculated metric was saved.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

parameters.name: favorite
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics that are favorites

parameters.name: approved
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics that are approved

parameters.name: pagination
parameters.description: return paginated results

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results per page

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (base 0 - first page is "0")

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: Sort direction (ASC or DESC)

parameters.name: sortProperty
parameters.description: Property to sort by (name, modified_date, id is currently allowed)

polarity.description: Set metric polarity, which indicates whether it's good or bad if a given metric goes up. Default=positive

precision.description: Number of decimal places to include in calculated metric result

400.description: Unable to retrieve list of calculated metrics shared with user

401.description: Owner filter error; user specified is not in the same company as the requesting user

403.description: Requesting non-shared calculated metrics for other users is restricted to admin users

500.description: External API error; Calculated metric retrieval failed

polarity.description: Set metric polarity, which indicates whether it's good or bad if a given metric goes up. Default=positive

precision.description: Number of decimal places to include in calculated metric result

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

parameters.name: cached
parameters.description: Use cached results

polarity.description: Set metric polarity, which indicates whether it's good or bad if a given metric goes up. Default=positive

precision.description: Number of decimal places to include in calculated metric result

400.description: Invalid input; name, rsid, and definition are all required. Definition must be formatted as a JSON Object.

500.description: External API error; Calculated metric create or retrieval failed

post.summary: Share 1 component with 1 user
post.description:
Note that only the following component types are currently supported: "segment", "project"
There are three valid values for "shareToType":
"all": Shares the component to all users in the organization. For this operation, "shareToImsUserId" is not required (ignored if sent)
"user": Shares the component with a specific user. For this operation, "shareToImsUserId" (the loginId of the user to share to) is required.
"group": Shares the component with an entire custom user group as defined in the Admin Console. For this operation, "shareToImsUserId" (the groupId of the group to share to) is required.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON-formatted Share object containing key-value pairs that conform to the Share schema

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

parameters.name: useCache
parameters.description: Use cache

400.description: Invalid component type

403.description: Permission error; user does not have access share the component

500.description: Unable to share component

put.summary: Share components with users. WARNING: Authoritative; deletes/overwrites all pre-existing shares for the given components
put.description: Create one/many shares for one/many components at once. For each component object in the passed list, the given shares will replace the current set of shares for each component. For example, if one of the components was previously shared with additional users, and that share is not passed in here, it will no longer be shared with them.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON-formatted ARRAY of objects containing key-value pairs that conform to the schema

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

parameters.name: useCache
parameters.description: Use caching for faster requests

400.description: Invalid component type, or mixed component types on request (only one type per request)

403.description: Permission error; user does not have access for the requested operation

500.description: Unable to save list of component shares

delete.summary: Disassociates all tags from the given components

put.summary: Tag a component with one or many tags at once. WARNING: Authoritative; deletes/overwrites all pre-existing associations
put.description: This endpoint allows many tags at once to be created/deleted. Any tags passed to this endpoint will become the *only* tags for that componentId (all other tags will be removed).

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON-formatted object containing key-value pairs that conform to the schema

components.description: the list of components that have been tagged with this tag
the list of components that have been tagged with this tag

500.description: Unable to save tag list.

parameters.description: Controls if Oberon should remote load data.  Default behavior is true with fallback to false if remote data does not exist

parameters.name: useCache
parameters.description: Use caching for faster requests (Use cached dimensions to speed up permission checks - This does not do any report caching)

parameters.name: useResultsCache
parameters.description: Use results caching for faster reporting times (This is a pass through to Oberon which manages the Cache)

parameters.name: includeOberonXml
parameters.description: Controls if Oberon XML should be returned in the response - DEBUG ONLY

parameters.name: includePlatformPredictiveObjects
parameters.description: Controls if platform Predictive Objects should be returned in the response. Only available when using Anomaly Detection or Forecasting- DEBUG ONLY

400.description: Invalid input; name, dataId, and definition are all required. Definition must be formatted as a JSON Object.

post.summary: Runs a report for the request in the post body

parameters.name: allowRemoteLoad
parameters.description: Controls if Oberon should remote load data.  Default behavior is true with fallback to false if remote data does not exist

parameters.name: useCache
parameters.description: Use caching for faster requests (Use cached dimensions to speed up permission checks - This does not do any report caching)

parameters.name: useResultsCache
parameters.description: Use results caching for faster reporting times (This is a pass through to Oberon which manages the Cache)

parameters.name: includeOberonXml
parameters.description: Controls if Oberon XML should be returned in the response - DEBUG ONLY

parameters.name: includePlatformPredictiveObjects
parameters.description: Controls if platform Predictive Objects should be returned in the response. Only available when using Anomaly Detection or Forecasting- DEBUG ONLY

400.description: Invalid input; name, dataId, and definition are all required. Definition must be formatted as a JSON Object.

get.summary: Returns a top items report for the given dimension
get.description:
Get the top X items (based on paging restriction) for the specified dimension and dataId. Defaults to last 90 days.

Search Clause examples:
contains test: 'test'

 contains test or test1: 'test' OR 'test1'

contains test and test1: 'test' AND 'test1'

contains test and not (test1 or test2): 'test' AND NOT ('test1' OR 'test2')

does not contain test: NOT 'test'

parameters.name: dataId
parameters.description: Data Group or Data View to run the report against

parameters.name: dimension
parameters.description: Dimension to run the report against. Example: "variables/page"

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

parameters.name: dateRange
parameters.description: Format: YYYY-MM-DD/YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: search-clause
parameters.description: General search string; wrap with single quotes. Example: 'PageABC'

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Format: YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Format: YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: searchAnd
parameters.description: Search terms that will be AND-ed together. Space delimited.

parameters.name: searchOr
parameters.description: Search terms that will be OR-ed together. Space delimited.

parameters.name: searchNot
parameters.description: Search terms that will be treated as NOT including. Space delimited.

parameters.name: searchPhrase
parameters.description: A full search phrase that will be searched for.

parameters.name: allowRemoteLoad
parameters.description: Controls if Oberon should remote load data.  Default behavior is true with fallback to false if remote data does not exist

parameters.name: includeOberonXml
parameters.description: Controls if Oberon XML should be returned in the response - DEBUG ONLY

parameters.name: lookupNoneValues
parameters.description: Controls None values to be included

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results per page

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (base 0 - first page is "0")

403.description: User does not have access to run this report

500.description: Unexpected error; failed to run report

post.summary: Returns a segment summary report for the segment definition in the post body
post.description:
Requires dataId and definition. Used to validate a segment definition and return basic reporting metrics for that definition. 


The response contains products that the definition is compatible with, as well as a series of totals that represent how many Page Views, Visits, and Visitors the segment includes.

Format for the order of Totals in response:


1) Number of Page Views that the segment includes for the given time period

2) Number of Visits that the segment includes for the given time period

3) Number of Unique Visitors that the segment includes for the given time period

4) Total number of Page Views for the time period (non-segmented)

5) Total number of Visits for the time period (non-segmented)

6) Total number of Unique Visitors for the time period (non-segmented)


The overall totals (3-6) can be used with the segment totals (1-3) to determine the percentage of the segment's audience for each metric.

Example definition for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):


```

{
	"func": "segment",
	"container": {
		"func": "container",
		"context": "hits",
		"pred": {
			"func": "exists",
			"description": "Page",
			"val": {
				"func": "attr",
				"name": "variables/page"
			}
		}
	},
	"version": [1, 0, 0]
}


```

parameters.name: dataId
parameters.description: Data Group or Data View ID to run the report against

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

parameters.name: dateRange
parameters.description: Format: YYYY-MM-DD/YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Format: YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Format: YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: allowRemoteLoad
parameters.description: Controls if Oberon should remote load data.  Default behavior is true with fallback to false if remote data does not exist

parameters.name: includeOberonXml
parameters.description: Controls if Oberon XML should be returned in the response - DEBUG ONLY

parameters.name: includeVisitorsMcvisid
parameters.description: Controls if Visitors with Experience Cloud ID should be returned in the response

parameters.name: includePerformanceScore
parameters.description: Controls if performance score should be returned in the response

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Segment definition

400.description: Bad JSON input; request not formatted correctly

403.description: User does not have access to run this report

500.description: Unexpected error; failed to run report

get.summary: Retrieves paginated segments
get.description:
A segment response will always include these default items:
id

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:
name: Name of the segment
description: Description of the segment
dataId: Associated Data ID of the segment
owner: Owner of the segment
modified: Date that the segment was last modified (ISO 8601)
definition: Segment definition as JSON object
compatibility: Products that the segment is compatible with
isDeleted: Returns whether or not the segment is 'Deleted' (note that deleted segments are only returned if requested by ID)

parameters.name: expansion
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of additional segment metadata fields to include on response.

parameters.name: includeType
parameters.description: Include additional segments not owned by user.

parameters.name: dataIds
parameters.description: Filter list to only include segments tied to the specified data group ID list (comma-delimited)

parameters.name: ownerId
parameters.description: Filter list to only include segments owned by the specified imsUserId

parameters.name: filterByIds
parameters.description: Filter list to only include segments in the specified list (comma-delimited list of IDs). This has filtered Ids from tags, approved, favorites and user specified Ids list.

parameters.name: toBeUsedInRsid
parameters.description: The report suite where the segment is intended to be used.  This report suite will be used to determine things like compatibility and permissions.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter list to only include segments that contains the Name

parameters.name: filterByModifiedAfter
parameters.description: Filter list to only include segments modified since this date (ISO8601 format)

parameters.name: cached
parameters.description: return cached results

parameters.name: pagination
parameters.description: Return paginated results

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results per page

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (base 0 - first page is "0")

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: Sort direction (ASC or DESC

parameters.name: sortProperty
parameters.description: Property to sort by (name, modified_date, performanceScore, id is currently allowed)

400.description: Unable to retrieve list of segments shared with user

401.description: Owner filter error; user specified is not in the same organization as the requesting user

403.description: Requesting non-shared segments for other users is restricted to admin users

500.description: External API error; Segment retrieval failed

post.summary: Creates a new segment
post.description:
Creates a new segment. The following attributes are available when creating a segment:
Required: name, definition, dataId
Example definition for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):
"definition":{"func":"segment","container":{"func":"container","context":"hits","pred":{"func":"exists","description":"Page","val":{"func":"attr","name":"variables/page"}}},"version":[1,0,0]}

SegmentResponse
A segment response will always include these default items:
id

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:
name: Name of the segment
description: Description of the segment
dataId: Associated Data ID of the segment
owner: Owner of the segment
modified: Date that the segment was last modified (ISO 8601)
definition: Segment definition as JSON object
compatibility: Products that the segment is compatible with
isDeleted: Returns whether or not the segment is 'Deleted' (note that deleted segments are only returned if requested by ID)

parameters.name: expansion
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of additional segment metadata fields to include on response.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON-formatted Object containing key/value pairs for segment creation.

imsUserId.description: the ims org id of the owner, included when the expansion parameter owner is true

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

parameters.name: cached
parameters.description: Use cached results

imsUserId.description: the ims org id of the owner, included when the expansion parameter owner is true

400.description: Invalid input; name, rsid, and definition are all required. Definition must be formatted as a JSON Object.

500.description: External API error; Segment create or retrieval failed

post.summary: Validate a Segment
post.description: Returns a segment validation for the segment contained in the post body of the report.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Segment definition

400.description: Bad JSON input; request not formatted correctly

500.description: Unexpected error;

get.summary: Retrieves a single segment by ID
get.description:
A segment response will always include these default items:
id

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:
name: Name of the segment
description: Description of the segment
dataId: Associated Data ID of the segment
owner: Owner of the segment
modified: Date that the segment was last modified (ISO 8601)
definition: Segment definition as JSON object
compatibility: Products that the segment is compatible with
isDeleted: Returns whether or not the segment is 'Deleted' (note that deleted segments are only returned if requested by ID)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The segment ID to retrieve

parameters.name: toBeUsedInRsid
parameters.description: The report suite where the segment is intended to be used.  This report suite will be used to determine things like compatibility and permissions.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

parameters.name: expansion
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of additional segment metadata fields to include on response.

imsUserId.description: the ims org id of the owner, included when the expansion parameter owner is true

403.description: Requesting non-shared segments for other users is restricted to admin users

500.description: External API error; segment retrieval failed

put.summary: Make changes or updates to an existing segment
put.description:
The following fields can be modified through this endpoint:
name, description, definition, owner, rsid, aamStatus

Note: "aamStatus" is used to "publish" a report suite segment to other products in the Experience Cloud. Description is always required when publishing with aamStatus. The report suite must already be pre-configured for AAM for publishing to succeed (see the "/segments/aamStatus/" endpoint for more information).
Format for aamStatus object:
"aamStatus":{"published":["rsid1","rsid2"]}

Example "defintion" for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):
"definition":{"func":"segment","container":{"func":"container","context":"hits","pred":{"func":"exists","description":"Page","val":{"func":"attr","name":"variables/page"}}},"version":[1,0,0]}

Response will be the newly modified segment object after the update request completes.

SegmentResponse
A segment response will always include these default items:
id

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:
name: Name of the segment
description: Description of the segment
dataId: Associated Data ID of the segment
owner: Owner of the segment
modified: Date that the segment was last modified (ISO 8601)
definition: Segment definition as JSON object
compatibility: Products that the segment is compatible with
isDeleted: Returns whether or not the segment is 'Deleted' (note that deleted segments are only returned if requested by ID)

parameters.name: expansion
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of additional segment metadata fields to include on response.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Segment ID to be updated

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON-formatted Object containing key/value pairs to be updated.

imsUserId.description: the ims org id of the owner, included when the expansion parameter owner is true

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

parameters.name: cached
parameters.description: Use cached results

imsUserId.description: the ims org id of the owner, included when the expansion parameter owner is true

400.description: Definition must be formatted as a JSON Object

401.description: Company mismatch; segment ownership can only be transferred within the same organization

403.description: User does not have permission to update this segment

500.description: External API error; Segment update or retrieval failed

delete.summary: Deletion of a Segment by Id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of segment to be deleted

500.description: Segment delete failed

post.summary: Computes a segment performance score.
post.description:
Returns a segment performance score for either the segment id or the segment contained in the post body of the report.

Example definition for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):
{"func":"segment","container":{"func":"container","context":"hits","pred":{"func":"exists","description":"Page","val":{"func":"attr","name":"variables/page"}}},"version":[1,0,0]}

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The segment ID to compute performance score on

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Segment definition

400.description: Bad JSON input; request not formatted correctly

500.description: Unexpected error;
